Analyze the following text: A method of estimating an orientation of a camera 3 relative to a surface 5 wherein a camera coordinate system is defined and a normal vector normal to the surface 5 is represented by three components in the camera coordinate system the method comprising providing a first image and a subsequent second image captured by the camera 3 selecting a first point from the first image and a second point from the second image wherein the first and second points represent the same object defining a first optical flow vector connecting the first point and the second point carrying out a first estimation step comprising estimating two components of the normal vector in the camera coordinate system by using the first optical flow vector and restricting parameter space to only the two components of the normal vector wherein a linear equation system derived from a homography matrix that represents a projective transformation between the first image and the second image is provided and the two components of the normal vector in the camera coordinate system are estimated by solving the linear equation system and determining the orientation of the camera 3 relative to the surface 5 using the results of the first estimation step.

output terminal of the amplifier 2 said electronic circuit further comprisinga first additional capacitor CRES1 anda first coupling circuit RD1 RD2 configured to operate alternatively in a respective first operating modewhere it connects the first additional capacitor CRES1 in parallel to the first feedback capacitor Cr1 and in a respective second operating mode where it decouples the first additional capacitor CRES1 from the first feedback capacitor Cr1and wherein said first switch RESET1 is configured to switch from the first operating mode to the second operating mode at a first instant t2 in which one VCORin of the first and second input components VCORin VQUADin assumes a first zero value and in which the other VQUADin of said first and second input components VCORin output component VQUADout which are a function of the first and second input components VCORin VQUADinrespectively the output component VQUADout that is a function of said other VQUADin of said first and second input components VCORin VQUADin differing at said first instant t2 from a corresponding first ideal value said first ideal value being a function of said nonzero value and of a steadystate gain value equal to the gain of said electronic circuit when the first switch RESET1 and the first coupling circuit RD1 RD2 operate in the respectivesecond operating mode and wherein the first at a distance in time from the first instant t2 that is half of said period and in which said one VCORin of the first and second input components VCORin VQUADin assumes a second zero value in such a
